website_summaries.verdict: Super lightweight option with a wide mouth for big debris.
pros: A big 31.8-ounce dirt bowl can hold a lot of debris before needing to be emptied, letting you keep cleaning
It is also clear, so you can easily see when it needs emptying
Convenient wall mount (which is included) keeps the vacuum right where you need it
cons: Some users prefer a one-step charging mount (this model needs to be plugged and unplugged on the wall mount)

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum does not hold a charge. I charged it for 18 hours as the directions said to and the vacuum stays on for a mere 2 minutes!
customer_reviews.author: C Desmond

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work well for picking up dog hair
customer_reviews.text: I have a super shedding basset hound. He sheds everywhere, every day. I got this to try to combat all the hair that is all over my house, but it doesn't do a great job in picking them all up. The battery doesn't last as long as it takes to vacuum the couch. And the suctioning power isn't strong enough to lift many of the hairs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: STOPPED WORKING, less than 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working! Bought this in October, finally opened it and plugged it in a month later, and two months later it can't hold a charge for more than 10 seconds! I don't know why. The charger cord is fine, we plug it in after use. I am so disappointed, it didn't last for even three months! I'm getting a dyson hand vac now, I'm tired of buying this over and over. Our last one had the same issue but I thought it was just old. No, it's Black and Decker.
customer_reviews.author: Aprilluv4

customer_reviews.title: Works Well- See Pros & Cons
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Comes with wall mounted charger, powerful/works well, decent battery life Cons: #1 You can't mount and go- you need to plug the dust buster in, and then hang it on the wall (or vice versa); #2 There is no light to indicate whether it is charging, done charging, etc...
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Poor design of van container catch mechanism.  Lasted less than one month before breaking- no longer usable.
customer_reviews.text: Received this product November 25th. Used infrequently for small pickup jobs in the kitchen. By December 24th it is unusable. The catch mechanism that fastens the air container to the motor and handle broke (small cheap plastic part) broke and it won't snap back into position to be used. I did find it on sale but even then cost is $1/day. Not sure if I am going to repeat this mistake,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: Really difficult to clean, and started to smell after a while. Looked like dust/mold started accumulating in crevices and areas that couldn't be reached. Would not recommend if living in a really humid area. Threw it out and bought a different handheld portable with bag.
customer_reviews.author: bronze owl

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life is 10 minutes after a full charge
customer_reviews.text: Products battery life is pretty bad like the reviews say. I gave the manufacturer a chance by purchasing it, hoping the battery issue was fixed. I charged the vacuum for a full 24 hours after opening the box and it lasted 10 minutes. I chalked it up to issues with a first-time charge so I charged it another 12 hours and used it the next day. The same thing happened, only lasted 10 minutes. If you only need the vacuum for 10 minutes at a time it works fine, otherwise not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Updated B&D Hand Vac
customer_reviews.text: This unit a replacement for older, many years useful B&D Vac. Seems to do the job well; suggest "conditioning" battery prior to initially using unit by totally discharging battery & recharging totally several times. This should insure max. battery life w/o setting artifical low - full chg. at less than actual "full" chg point.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Is it a vacuum or a blower?
customer_reviews.text: I dont like it for these reasons: 1. Initially it was worning fine. But after a month, it started to automatically switch off automatically. Initially, I thought I was not charging it properly and made sure it is properly before using it, but the problem repeated. 2. I bought this vacuum for cleaning my couch and car seats. But the suction power is very less and and does a very bad job of sucking the dirt in. I does not serve the purpose at all. but infact it blows more air out then it sucks the dust in. So very unhappy with the purchase and entirely regret my decision.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: BLACK+DECKER HHVI315JO42 Dustbuster
customer_reviews.text: I was worried after reading some critical reviews but this looked the best of several brands as far as easy of use, suction, and durablity. I was pleased after it arrived. It has very good suction is fairly lightweight and seems to maintain a charge, I don't run it long so don't know how long it will run on one charge. No harder to clean than any other dustbuster I've had. I like that it is clear and can see how much is in it. It has a removable filter that can be washed and let dry if gets too dirty.
customer_reviews.author: P. Mendelberg

customer_reviews.title: Poor suction for cat litter and heavier particles
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for quick clean ups of loose, tracked cat litter in my mudroom. Although it works marginally well on linoleum, it doesn’t work at all on low-pile throw rugs. As you can see in the video, it barely touches the litter particles. Bin is very hard to empty completely of all particles, even when removing filter. For very light spot vacuuming of tiny particles, maybe this would be an okay option, but if you’re looking to handle larger/heavier bits like cat litter, this is not a good option.
customer_reviews.author: chiquitita230

customer_reviews.title: No Charging Indicator Light
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't find a charge indicator to tell when the battery is finished charging. I went to the B & D website to look at the specs and find out it doesn't have one. How are you supposed to know when it's fully charged? The manual says something about 16 hours minimum charge when it's new, but nothing else. It's very loud and the suction is OK but not great. The wall mount bracket is fine but the charging cord is not held in very well. I would not recommend this product. Am disappointed in Black and Decker.
customer_reviews.author: Dubs

customer_reviews.title: Horrible! Guess we got a bad one.
customer_reviews.text: I’m so disappointed in this dust buster, We charged it all night long and the Battery only lasted 15 seconds. It will die quickly after what should have been a full charge. I’m returning it! From the reviews, it seems that half of them are good and half are bad. Hope you get lucky!
customer_reviews.author: yosh j rau

customer_reviews.title: This little vacuum didn't spit out powder smoke like I've seen some other vacuums do
customer_reviews.text: This thing saves me a little sanity on the regular with two little terrorists on the rise. Sometimes emptying it is a little awkward with the filter but the flip side of this is after I got to vacuum up baking soda my kid knocked out of the pantry. This little vacuum didn't spit out powder smoke like I've seen some other vacuums do. I'll keep the awkward filter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works for what I need it for
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying i keep my car clean. Unfortunately as a smoker with a brand new car/black interior, the ashes were driving me crazy. I bought this for the sole purpose to daily pick up cig ashes. For that purpose, this thing is awesome. Now, i don't have kids but i know people that do. This thing in my humble opinion would not handle french fries, bubble gum, dog fur, throw up, or large crumbs of any kind. I had to recharge it after 30 minutes of light ash pickup but then, that is why i bought it.
customer_reviews.author: S Burns

customer_reviews.title: small but mighty
customer_reviews.text: I have had this dustbuster for almost 2 years. It works great and cleans up small messes quickly and easily. I use it often when potting plants for example. I keep it charged when I am not using it and when the filter is clogged I have washed it in the sink and it works again. Edit! It has now been 3 years and even though it is constantly on the charging dock in no longer holds power for more than 30-45seconds before turning off. I can usually turn it on again 2 more times, again for only 30 seconds or so but then it has to go back to be charged again...
customer_reviews.author: Mike T

customer_reviews.title: Ok vac
customer_reviews.text: Vacuum stop working after three months with no rhyme and reason. I’m only used it to vacuum in between sofa cushion and my car. Would not recommend. Only reason I’m giving three stars because black and decker customer service was great. No questions asked and they sent me a new one within seven to ten business days. Hopefully, this one will last.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Large capacity canister
customer_reviews.text: Like: large capacity canister Great suction Fairly quiet Washable filter Easy to clean Comes with 2 attachments Charges quickly after the initial 16 hour charge Dislike: No battery indicator light No charging light Shorter battery life ( about 10-15 minutes) Some items get stuck inside the sides of The canister Not the best for picking up hair from fabrics Cannot be used while charging
customer_reviews.author: Christine Thibeault

customer_reviews.title: What happened to the battery?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vacuum cleaner in May/17 and everything was perfect until last month (dec/18). I use this vaccum daily because I have 3 toddlers that love to make a mess when eating. The problem now is the battery. I leave a whole night charging and when I use it I can not get more than 15 seconds of operation. After 1.5 years of daily use, the battery is dead. I know that eventually that would be a problem, like any device with a battery, but I really thought that it would last at least 3 or 4 years without problems.
customer_reviews.author: Joao

customer_reviews.title: Dustbuster... more like dustmover.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this dustbuster to help with light chores around the house. Similar to other what other reviewers have commented on, not having a light to notify when its fully charged is extremely annoying. The battery life (even when fully charged) lasts minutes, doubling the amount of time it takes to clean. Lastly, the little valve on the inside gets stuck in the open position letting dust out. Hence, it does the opposite of what it's intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Metsfan1051

customer_reviews.title: it seems useful for small areas only
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived in tact and on time, we plugged it in and left it charging for 2 days. Then, when I went to use it in the car, it ran for 5 seconds and stopped. I turned it off, turned it back on. It ran for another 5 seconds and stopped. Did this repeatedly with no changes. Not only did it malfunction, but the end of the vacuum is so small that it would have taken a really long time to vacuum the floor of our vehicle with it. Even if it did work, it seems useful for small areas only, not for autos. Frustrated and returning it!
customer_reviews.author: CNB

customer_reviews.title: Helpful device
customer_reviews.text: It is the second one that I bought. I am trying to stop my husband from buying the third one. He wants it in every room now. I put the first one on the wall in a hallway and the second one in the kitchen. It makes my life much easier because I have three dogs. Now I do not need to run after big vacuum cleaner every time they chew something or make a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: A total waste of time
customer_reviews.text: This black and decker DustBuster is a total waste of time and money. It does not pull any dust unless you touch it to the area and the pull/clean of the dust is painstakingly slow. It won't pull a tiniest spec. I bought this product because my dirtdevil vacuum got damaged. So I decided to give this brand a try. Big mistake. I charged it for 24 hours before using it. It is useless. I regret buying this product. I have reordered the Dirtdevil.
customer_reviews.author: Ayemen

customer_reviews.title: Love this little guy!
customer_reviews.text: This has helped me immensely in my quest to keep my house clean. I needed a small hand vacuum and really didn't want to deal with wires, and this has delivered! Storage is a breeze with a nice dock on the wall near a power outlet to charge, and the vacuum itself is perfect for what I need - stubborn short hairs, small debris, etc. It's obviously no substitute for a standard vacuum but as a product I've had no issues with battery life or general use and cleaning it out is a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Haradria

customer_reviews.title: The new generation Dustbuster is a winner!
customer_reviews.text: I have had Black & Decker Dustbusters for 15 years, but none as powerful as this little guy! The Lithium Ion battery makes all the difference in suction power and maintaining that power over sufficient time to get my cleaning jobs done. The old versions slowed down quickly and only did an adequate job, this one is making a big difference in my household, especially with pet hair! It also maintains the charge for a long time. I'm very happy I purchased this new model and can't wait to use it in my car where I expect to have similar great results.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy M.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, great for quick clean up, good suction
customer_reviews.text: I use this for vacuuming up hair in the bathroom, dirt on high-traffic back/front door rugs, or crumbs in the kitchen. I typically sweep our hardwood floors every few days and instead of a dustpan, use this to clean up what's been collected. It charges quickly, lasts for a good while (by the time the battery needs to be recharged - I could probably use a break from vacuuming anyway!), and has good suction. I have one of these upstairs, and one downstairs in our home. Use it all the time and would highly recommend! Also, it's easy to clean out.
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Worked great - for 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT waste your money on this. I read the reviews before I purchased, and was a little skeptical because of the battery, but I thought if I followed the instructions for charging correctly (especially the first time) I might be okay. FALSE. I followed the recommendations (let it die completely, then do a complete charge) I got maybe 5 uses out of this thing before the battery completely died. I've charged it and charged it, and it won't run for more than 1 minute without shutting off. I've even tried using it while it's plugged in and it still shuts off. Save your money and buy a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Jourdan Moore

customer_reviews.title: Best Ever
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased a lot of dustbusters... and i mean a lot.. i have cats and have to clean up their litter . it sucks up everything - great suction power on litter, cat hair, human hair you name it. it works better then any other dust buster i have bought.. i've even thought about buying this in bulk for when/if this one goes out... you will not be disappointed plus the way the top is shaped it gets under the cabinets, etc.. it's just a great buy. Lightweight, easy to clean and use and the charge seems to last forever.
customer_reviews.author: HTX

customer_reviews.title: For those reviewers that complain about battery life
customer_reviews.text: This a GREAT little dustbuster...but, YOU MUST REMEMBER THAT IT DOES NOT HAVE A SMART CHARGER! That means that after the initial charge, YOU MUST UNPLUG IT FROM THE CHARGER. Otherwise, the battery will remain on constant charge until it eventually burns up the battery! Charge it ONCE A MONTH for 4 to 8 hours, then unplug it from the charger. It will remain charged for the entire month at full strength, and not wear out the battery!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ferdy

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life Is Awful.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Comes with a wall mount for it, looks nice, has decent suction, and is cordless. Cons: Absolutely horrendous battery life. I charged the vacuum overnight for around 12 hours or so and when I start getting into cleaning it lasted about 10 minutes before it auto shut-off due to low battery. I tried seeing if I could use the device while plugged in and even THAT doesn't work. I'd highly recommend finding some other cordless vacuum that will actually last long enough to get anything done.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Wilson

customer_reviews.title: No storage for attachment heads
customer_reviews.text: I just put it up on the wall so I can't say how well it holds up. My issue with this product is that there is nowhere to store the attachment heads that come with the vaccuum. It makes no sense as they will get misplaced. You cannot attatch both at the same time to the vaccuum to store together either. It would have made a much better product had the wall hanger had a place to put the attachments for the vacuum as well.
customer_reviews.author: V. Gindratt

customer_reviews.title: Was great - until I dropped it.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I loved this Dustbuster. It had incredible suction and not even cat litter could hide. The battery lasted long enough to go through the whole house and then some. But then one day, I accidentally dropped it onto the carpet and it fell all of two feet. Since then, the motor is incredibly loud and the suction is greatly reduced, so the motor must have knocked loose. Too bad, since this is a great product but not very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Jean

customer_reviews.title: Not strong at all
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hand vacuum to be able to vacuum my minivan. I have 4 children, and my van gets filthy. I charged the vacuum and went to work. First, it did not suck up the big chunks! I put the narrowing attachment on, and with much force, I sucked up a little dirt and debris. Then, the battery died after only vacuuming the driver floor area and the floor behind the driver seat. When I looked at it later, it didn't look vacuumed at all. Unfortunately, I did not get my butt in gear soon enough to return it. So, instead, I am writing a review so other will not buy this hand vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: David Hubbell

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra money on something nicer
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive so I wasn't expecting anything crazy but I went to vacuum off my ottoman really quick and this did not do the job. I was go over some pretty dusty spots and it seemed like I wasn't picking up anything. Probably ok for big items that spill, like cereal or something, but I wouldn't recommend this and next time will just spend the extra money on a nicer one.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Good cleanup device for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several of these over the years, and for picking up stray "stuff" on the floor they just seem to get better and better. The power of this simple device is quite adequate and the battery life (between charges) is really good. I use it infrequently, and the battery charge lasts over two months. Heavier usage will obviously affect that. Finally, it's easy to clean/empty. What more can you say about a simple Dustbuster?
customer_reviews.author: DIY

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: very poor quality, battery does not last long at all.
customer_reviews.author: nick N.A

customer_reviews.title: Loovveee it
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! It's bigger than I expected (which is a good thing) and holds quite a bit. I was a bit skeptical when I saw the photo of someone vacuuming up large pieces like cereal but now that I see the product in person, it could definitely pick up larger pieces like that. When it's empty it is really light, my 7 year old has no problem maneuvering it. When it's full, depending on what you've vacuumed up, it's still manageable. All around love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Tyleena Gloekler

customer_reviews.title: Quite a bit different from the first one we purchased
customer_reviews.text: The first one we purchased had a charging pad on to which the unit set. There was a blue light that came on and blinked when it was charging and it was on full when the charging was complete. This one has no charging pad but comes with a small cord that plugs into the unit and there is no charging light. Very very dissatisfied with the second unit. Changes to a great product which we use at home and now this one for a mom and pop business is not the same quality for the same price. I would look into the unit with the charging pad, much nicer!!
customer_reviews.author: James F. Korinek

customer_reviews.title: Strong suction, but hate the charging cord
customer_reviews.text: I like this hand vacuum, but if I had known that I would need to plug in the charging cord to the handheld unit for charging, I never would have bought it. Who came up with that design idea? It's inconvenient and really frustrating! I've had dustbusters before and they automatically charge when you simply place them back into the wall bracket....I've never seen one like this. I also wish the battery would last longer. On a positive note, I think it has powerful suction for quick clean-ups around the house. It works great for pet hair and vacuuming the stairs.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sisbarro

customer_reviews.title: Oh Joy! HHV1320JR02
customer_reviews.text: I charged it for more than a day. It does the job even though it is not a very strong suction. Picked up all sorts of dust, fuzzies and Hair. The problem is it keeps shutting off. I push the button off and then on and it runs for 10 seconds and shuts off. I even used the power chord to vacuum and it’s shutting off. Argh! Black and Decker is closed on the weekends. Oh Joy! HHV1320JR02. Model #. Update, I recharged and have left it plugged in. So far it’s been working without shutting off. I never did talk to manufacturers.
customer_reviews.author: E. Carrozza

customer_reviews.title: A Pleasant Surprise
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this product for a few days, but in those days I've vacuumed nearly the entire house with it and have had absolutely zero problems picking anything up. It's worked on hair, cat litter, dirt and even a few small screws that I didn't see when I started. It's been a solid purchase so far and shows no sign of slowing down or stopping.
customer_reviews.author: John David Edgar Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Go back to basics...
customer_reviews.text: I owned the old model for 17 years and then the battery gave out. This replaced it. The new design looked promising with the built on tools, but I had to take off the brush as I didn't use it and it collected dirt. I often have to put it back together as the latches don't hold it together after any slightly vicarious use. The old one was only two body parts and was sturdy. It's aggravating, constantly putting it back together.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Field Smith

customer_reviews.title: Powerful lightweight
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I love keeping a hand vac in several parts of my house - they are great for quick pick ups. This one is in the master bath, I love the light weight and power that lets me clean up daily hair that collects in corners! ( is it all mine? Why am I not bald!) anyway, I’ve been using it daily for about 2 mos, powerful, lightweight, easy to empty, quick charge time, lots of use time between charges, nice price, what more do you want in a hand vac?!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kim in Jupiter

customer_reviews.title: Best hand held vac ever
customer_reviews.text: This "hand held vacuum," which I really wany to call a dust buster as I am a child of the 90s, is amazing! In the two and a halfish months we've had it we've only had to charge it ONCE! We use it daily, multiple times a day. Its great if you have a toddler that wants to grind crackers into your carpet, its great if you are clumsy and incapable of pouring your quinoa into your rice cooker, its even great to clean up dust. Perhaps you are terrified of the stink bug menace taking over the midwest, yep, great for getting rid of those giant freaks too!
customer_reviews.author: Hstombernogg

customer_reviews.title: DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing stopped automatically twice on first use. Was a real pain since I purchased for quick clean up jobs, and I have someone come in and clean once a week, so house doesn’t get dirty enough for this thing to plug up and automatically stop. Twice!! There was hardly any dirt in it! Very disappointed. Waste of money in my opinion because it ends up being quicker to get the big vac out, use it and put it away. I’ll end up giving it away.
customer_reviews.author: C. E.

customer_reviews.title: Works well, nice accessories
customer_reviews.text: Good suction, picks up nearly everything . It Does leave behind some tiny crumbs and dirt in crevices that id probably get with a full vacuum. Not a deal breaker to me but it is almost as loud as a full size vacuum. Comes with some good brushes and crevice tool, the storage wall mount is very nice, didn’t have that on my last dust buster. Also has a port for the charging wire so you can keep it charged when not in use. Pops open very easily for cleaning, seems to have pretty good battery so far, happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joe S

customer_reviews.title: Great hand vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I use this little guy every day. At 84 years of age I have trouble bending over when the inevitable debris appears on the floor. Rether drag the big vacuum, unwind and rewind the cord I use this cordless. Suction decreases rapidly a dust accumulates on the washable filter bag but this one is better than others I have used. If you buy I suggest you purchase spare filters so you always have a dry spare ready to go. Have never run the battery down but again the purpose of this hand vac is a quick brief pick up. Worth the money in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: R. H. Zentgraf

customer_reviews.title: Not too Heavy and Suction nicely: No charging indicator light.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been skeptical to buy this product based on previous experience with other products, but 2 of my friend encouraged me to buy and I instantly fell in love. The only Cons I’ve observed so far is that there is no charging indicating light. Sometimes you don’t know if it’s really charging or when it’s sufficient to take it off power. But Overall, in terms of efficient and suction, this is really great and will recommend it for more people.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzieluv

customer_reviews.title: Great for quick cleanups
customer_reviews.text: Very useful for cleaning up quick!! I use it around the litter box and it makes quick work over using a dustpan. Also strangely very useful for dusting?? I was surprised at how much loose dust this thing sucks up. Unfortunately it doesn’t hold a super long charge (or I’m just relying on it too much over busting out the vacuum, haha). Not sure I could clean my whole car upholstery on one charge. Either way it’s definitely worth it for quick clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa K

customer_reviews.title: Before the battery died it was pretty decent hand vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Item stopped taking a charge about a month after I got it. It was too late to return so I contacted black and decker. They sent me a brand new one, no questions asked. We will see how long this one lasts me. Before the battery died it was pretty decent hand vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: Not great as a car vacuum
customer_reviews.text: As a mama of a toddler, I was very excited to finally buy a hand-held vacuum. My main intention was to use this to clean out my car. Overall, it’s OKAY-not great, but ok. This vacuum was a little hard to get in certain areas because of the base size & The suction felt a little weak on the carpet of my car. It’s better than not having a vacuume so we won’t be returning it but it was a little disappointing. *Will update review as I use the vacuum in different areas of the house.
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on Prime Day for a really good price. We had an old crappy hand vac and it finally started to wheeze out enough that I felt justified replacing it. I really wish I hadn't waited. This one has really strong suction and it also has a good-sized canister so I'm not emptying it constantly. We have four cats and I feel like it does a good job with pet hair and on the stairs. It's a great product for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Karey

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had my own home for ten years and this is the FIRST TIME I’ve gotten a fast buster!! Why?!!! I don’t know. I have nothing to compare it to, but I really like it. My ONE complaint is that the filter is disposable and not cleanable, which is kind of a hassle. I feel like it’ll cost me more overall to be buying filters..I just failed to read that in the description before purchasing, and I’m not thrilled about it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Catapano

customer_reviews.title: This is a great dust buster!  I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: I was way overdue for a new and better dust buster, which I use every morning to tidy up after my cats and the bit of litter they scatter outside their litter box. This model is wonderfully light weight compared to my clunky older one, and has far better suction power and a bigger, easier to clean reservoir for dust and debris disposal. It is much easier to charge and holds the charge longer, too. I love it and only wish I had replaced the old one sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Hill Girl 8024

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I love my Dustbuster but after 8 months it started turning off after running about 5 seconds. I read other reviews that complained of the same issue. So I called Black and Decker. They asked me to read a batch number that is pressed into the plastic under the filter. They apologized for the problem and said they are sending me a new Dustbuster. So there must have been a bad batch and they are aware of it. That's the way you keep customers coming back again and again.
customer_reviews.author: K. Moore

customer_reviews.title: This machine is not only cute, it works fine!
customer_reviews.text: We needed a new dust buster and after reading review after review I landed on this one. One neat feature is the extension that is built-in. I am not tall and there was a bug crawling on the wall that I couldn't reach with this unit and then I remembered reading that the extension is built in - so I pulled it out and sucked that bug right off the wall! I have only had it a week but I know it is going to come in very handy.
customer_reviews.author: idealady

customer_reviews.title: NO charging dock like other models.
customer_reviews.text: It works fine for my purposes (sucking up Great Dane hair in my bedroom every day) but it doesn't have a docking station for charging like a different model I purchased about a year ago. It has a cord that plugs in to the base of the machine and the machine itself can stand upright in a corner (or be attached to a wall with the wall mount/screws included) but I prefer the other model where I don't have to unplug the machine before using it - I just grab the machine off the charging base, use it, and return it to the base without plugging or unplugging.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: Only worked for 20 mins! Will be returning!
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy with this little vaccuum to clean my car. The brush attachment was a dream for "scraping" sand from the floormats if you know what I mean. My car looked great. Until the vaccuum just stopped working after Only 20 mins. I had charged it all day! And it quit (thankfully) right as I finished up my last doorwell. Very dissappointed because I really wanted to love this amazing suction vaccuum. A complete lie on their end for it lasting 1.5hours - SMH! will be returning! At first I didn't believe the other reviews, but now I know what other people mean by defective batteries and short lengths of time. Buy something with better reviews!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFangirl

customer_reviews.title: Glad we bought it
customer_reviews.text: We've had this little vacuum about 3 months now and love it. I hated getting out the big vacuum for simple jobs but this bad boy is great to clean the car, nab those dust bunnies around the couch, clean up cookie crumbs, and all sorts of things that forever to clean. The battery will run full power and instead of tapering off it will just stop when the battery dies. I appreciate that feature. So far ours works just fine and I tell my husband each time how we should have gotten one a long time ago. If you have kids, you need this.
customer_reviews.author: Morwen Ilse

customer_reviews.title: Great Handheld Vac
customer_reviews.text: We have owned several handheld vacuums and this is by far the best. It suctions up hair, dust, dirt and even the occasional bug. An extendable wand is affixed to the end of the suction tube and it allows you to easily navigate tight spaces and reach at least a foot under furniture. Overall we have been pretty happy with the Dustbuster performance and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: DeePrinz

customer_reviews.title: battery life is awful
customer_reviews.text: I've had this vaccum for about 2 months now, use it to spot clean three area rugs. At first it was fine, but now it barely holds a charge. I can leave it charging overnight, then get maybe 5-7 minutes of vaccuming if I'm lucky before it dies again. And then takes another several hours to charge. Extremely inconveniant, and the cord it comes with is so short that I can't switch to using it on a cord when it dies. Sometimes I don't even get enough power to clean my three small rugs which is bananas. I'm out of the return window so I'm stuck with it. If you're considering this one, I'd say get a different model.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Good for a quick job, but not heavy cleaning
customer_reviews.text: I primarily use this to vacuum litter scattered around my cat's litterbox. It does the job, is easy to empty and clean, and comes with some helpful attachments (such as a bristled brush head and a thinner precision tool), but as others have said, it has a pretty weak suction. I have even sometimes had to pick up things to "feed" it instead of vacuuming it up. It also requires charging after one steady cleaning episode (maybe 30 minutes of on and off cleaning.)
customer_reviews.author: Holly Chan

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but it's LOUD!
customer_reviews.text: I got this a few days ago and I have used it several times. The suction is good and it picks up just about everything so far. Cleaning it is relatively easy, I only wish that the filter didn't hold onto the dog hair quite so well so I don't have to touch it, but honestly, it isn't that bad. My only complaint is that this thing is louder than my upright vacuum. I mean like you have to shout over it or turn it off to talk to someone in the same 5 feet as you. I'll update later as it gets some more use.
customer_reviews.author: Sean and Allie

customer_reviews.title: Love it except...
customer_reviews.text: This is at least the third dustbuster we've had over the years, but it's the very first one NOT to have a light that shows when it's charging and fully charged. Other than that, it's absolutely wonderful and I'm quite happy with it. We flat out wore the others out, where they do secondary service in my spouse's shop. I don't think we've thrown any of them away.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Seems like it’s not as high tech as their other models
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my old one, who’s fuse broke and was not fixable after a few years. I thought I was ordering the same but there’s like a thousand different models of this exact vacuum. This one has a plug in connector as opposed to a disk That wirelessly charges. I preferred the disk but whatever. This one doesn’t have a charging light to let you know it’s charged. Which is kinda annoying. I do prefer the filter on this model as it’s very clear to see if it’s dirty or not. The suction seems not as good as the other model I had but it’s fine.
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: Great power, but loud as hell...
customer_reviews.text: Great device. Strong suction. Good build quality. Easy to clean. Only complaints are 1. the noise - the sound it makes is ungodly loud. The neighbors will not be happy. And 2. no LED indicator - the lack of an indicator means you never know if it is charged or not. Not even if the charger is properly connected, let alone how full the battery is. This just seems bizarre. How can you omit a battery status LED??? BUT, the imperfections are minor, while the difference where it counts (i.e. suction), outweighs them by a significant margin. Out of all the hand-vacs in this price range, this is definitely your best option.
customer_reviews.author: Page-Flipper

customer_reviews.title: A little cleaning devil!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why send people are complaining! The one I got works perfectly! I got a refurbished one. Came with all the attachments, and an extra adapter that I have no idea what it is for 😳🤔, Worked perfectly on day one and still going strong. Charge holds. Use it for quick cleanups in the kitchen and bedroom. Worked miracles in my car. I don't keep it plugged in all the time. Just charge it overnight on Fridays so I'll have it handy on the weekends which is when I do my house chores. The charge holds the rest of the week.
customer_reviews.author: Ikram

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT BUY THIS ITEM,  Black and Decker HHVI315JO42 DUSTBUSTER
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this unit mid November 2018. It worked beautifully and i liked it a lot. Id nuse for vacuum upostery, small business rugs, light jobs and ONLY occasionally. After use it was was placed back into charger. The charge held for about 10 mi jtes when in use. A few weeks ago the unit s tarted to hold the less and less and now when use the unit shuts off after about 2 minuts.you restart and it stops in less then 30 seconds. This is terrible and I am disappointed. I will not buy this item again.
customer_reviews.author: ursula brown

customer_reviews.title: Great for Crumbs
customer_reviews.text: The dustbuster is exactly what I wanted to pick up crumbs - sweeping floor and then vacuum up the gatherings. Also works great for the crumbs/debris that settle in my kitchen drawers so I don't need to take everything out and turn drawers upside down. I've also used it for cleaning the door mats outside. I find that this little unit has a good suction. I don't know how long a charge lasts as it's never run out on me, but I usually only have it going for 5 or 10 minutes at a time. It is loud but again - only using it for a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Magee

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and runs a very long time - one small issue.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit based on other reviews. I had to wait as it was out of stock, but very much worth the wait. It has excellent suction and I can't get it to run down - not after almost 15 minutes of vacuuming. It would have gotten 5 stars if it had the old style wall mount that automatically charged the unit. I subtracted one star because of the need to plug in the charging cord. The mount is fine, but it only holds the vac, and doesn't charge until you plug in the cord. But - surely worth the 4 stars - works great.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy B.

customer_reviews.title: Good Vacuum, But Not for Dog Hair
customer_reviews.text: I used this to vacuum sand from the mats in my car and if I held it in a certain position it seemed to work quite well. Then I tried to vacuum up hair in the Edge that my daughter's dog had shed and it didn't pick up any of it. Then I used it on her car floor, too, and again it wouldn't pick up any of the hair. It does work great on the house carpet when there are crumbs or spots.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Eyes

customer_reviews.title: This sucks ;-)
customer_reviews.text: This is the best hand-held battery-operated vacuum we've owned. It's powerful enough to do the job, but light enough to not cause too much hand/arm strain. We use it to clean up ash around our wood stoves, dust balls that accumulate in our hallway, and in other out-of-the-way spots that are difficult to reach with our upright floor vac. The charging stand is easy to use and small enough to stay out of the way. The vac retains its charge for a reasonable length of use, and is relatively easy to clean. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: F. Fish

customer_reviews.title: I love this little guy!
customer_reviews.text: Been looking forward to getting a small vacuum for years. Finally got one and it's been so fun (I know I sound lame here) to quickly clean up here and there (instead of bringing out my big, clunky vacuum), plus, it's nice to run out to the car and tidy it up, too. The wall mount is also a nice addition, so now it hangs up all pretty and out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Done with this
customer_reviews.text: It was okay at first, certainly not great but I'm in the cat litter crowd and it was a decent tidy-up tool for in between regular vacuumings. I even hung it on the wall, very handy. Now it shuts off after half a minute, and the battery is internal and not replaceable. Suction is very poor and the litter falls out when it's turned off. I'd say it worked adequately for a bit less than 2 years, averaging about 10 minutes of use per week - not a total waste of money but now destined for the landfill. The next hand vac I buy will have better power and longer life.
customer_reviews.author: Suzy M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Suction, but 2 Major Design Flaws
customer_reviews.text: For a cordless handvac, this has strong suction, and it holds its charge for a good, long time. Unfortunately, there is no charge indicator to let you know when the battery is low or when it is charging or when it is full -- this is a MAJOR design flaw. The flip-up brush is a great idea, but the bristles are stiff and super short (0.25 inches), which makes it fairly useless for doing what you typically would want a brush to do. If all you are looking for is strong suction, this is a great option, but if you want versatility and user-friendly design, definitely look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy B

customer_reviews.title: doesn't hold a charge
customer_reviews.text: I've had this hand vac for ~ 2.5 years now. I've followed all the instructions for cleaning the filter and charging it but, I noticed (back then) that it started to not hold much of a charge...maybe for a few minutes at a time. I didn't think much of it until recently when it would work for about 20-30 seconds and then abruptly stop working. At first, I thought it wasn't charged. Nope, there's nothing wrong w/the charger. Now it works for about 10 seconds at a time, and not at full suction power either. I had such high hopes in the beginning, but, I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Genuinely mad I bought this.
customer_reviews.text: Is this a joke, Amazon?? The #1 best selling hand held vacuum. For WHO? Blind people?? I’m genuinely mad I bought this. What a waste of money. I thought I could replace my big vacuum that way I don’t have to lug it around. LOL. BYE. I MIGHT AS WELL lug around the big vacuum. Save yourself a headache & trying to return this POS. It doesn’t suck anything, it’s sad. /edit: read the instruction manual. Apparently you need 16 hours of charging for “full power” WHAT. No one wrote this in the reviews!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa R.

customer_reviews.title: Not terrible, but not the best
customer_reviews.text: After it's first charge, it didn't really last very long. I thought maybe I just didn't plug it in for long enough, but i'm not really sure honestly. I also don't like how the filter has to be replaced like every ten times you use it if you're doing heavier cleaning. I have a lot of cat hair in my room and dust and junk, and it just takes out the filter. Besides that though, it's wonderful for cleaning up smaller things, such as larger crumbs and small trash things.
customer_reviews.author: David Gulland

customer_reviews.title: No suction
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love it, put it in my car to clean the debris out of the floor board. However, the suction is minimal at least and I ended up using a whisk to clean my car and laying this aside. Will be returning. May buy a stronger vacuum in the same brand as it is a reputable name.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Joe

customer_reviews.title: Disposable b/c batteries cannot be replaced
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about two years which is what the warranty goes for. Now the battery holds a charge for about 45 seconds and is not under warranty. The bad news is the battery cannot be replaced as it is welded not plugged in or soldered. Basically the dustbuster is disposable unless you can weld a new battery on.
customer_reviews.author: G$$

customer_reviews.title: No more eraser dust on the tables!!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I were tired of cleaning the eraser dust from my kids writing/ drawing activities. We noticed it even more after the online teaching started due to Covid pandemic. I Had tried Midori small rolling thingy in the past but It did not work as effectively as I had thought. The regular vacuum is bulky to get it fired up and move over table surface and books and corners. Now with this, my kids (7 and 13 years) clean up after themselves following their eraser marathon!! They love to use this. It’s light weight and fun for them to use. Reaches corners.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Black and Decker dusbuster hand held vac
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this item. The first lasted almost four years before it went to dusbuster heaven. I use this very day, several times a day. I clean up all the small messes around the house with this little powerhouse. The suction is pretty decent for a small vac but it gets the job done. It cleans the dog hear pretty easily as well as dirt on the floor. It’s easy to put together, easy to get the cover off to empty it out, and the small filter is pretty simple to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: I initially reviewed this product and only gave it 3 stars because I bought it for my car to vacuum out and I had to do it two separate days due to it dying on my the first time (charged the whole recommenced amount prior to use). I’m giving it another star because it has came in handy a lot over the last few months and is a great little vacuum. Makes it easy to clean up messes in the kitchen. I also used it on my car again and it lasted the whole time. Maybe it didn’t fully charge the first time I tried to use it, not sure. Doesn’t do as well getting dog hair though.
customer_reviews.author: kayley

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I have a large, long haired dog, so I use it several times a week and it always leaves everything spotless! So much easier than trying to use a big vacuum for stairs and crevices. My bf even uses it to clean out his vehicle. I do wish the battery lasted longer, but otherwise I like the weight and suction power and it's not outrageously loud.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Groshong

customer_reviews.title: Good hand vac
customer_reviews.text: I basically use this to vac the couch, and chairs so it does a pretty good job. It is easy to clean, the filter removes and is replaced easily. The filter is also easy to clean, and there is only one way for it to go into the device, which makes it easy to put in instead of having to align markings. Depending on how much I use it, I only have to recharge every other week and I currently use it on a daily bases for 3-4 minutes at a time. The vac is lightweight and easy to store. I like it for what I need it for.
customer_reviews.author: Neil G

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is horrible
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great for the minute and a half the battery stays charged. Even when the battery dies, with it plugged into the wall it only works for 30 seconds before it dies again. You have to charge it for HOURS to get it to stay working for more than a couple minutes
customer_reviews.author: Akoone

customer_reviews.title: Junk battery
customer_reviews.text: This product is junk. I bought it to use on my boat after outing and small clean up around the house. When I plugged it in for the initial charge, I was confused that there was no indicator light. I quickly let that go. After 24 hours of charging, I used the vacuum about 4 separate times for a total of approximately 5 minutes before it died. This battery is garbage. One of the only positive notes on the vacuum is that the suction is pretty good for the size but not the battery life makes this thing junk.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D.

customer_reviews.title: Battery does not hold a charge
customer_reviews.text: After receiving the product, i allowed it to charge the 16 hours initially. Set a timer for 30 minutes to see how long the battery would last. It worked for 14 minutes! Not even enough time to vacuum a couch with pet hair. Say 2 i allowed it to charge over night, approx. 20 hours in total from the day before use, Worked 10 minutes then died. Very disappointing due to its over all rating and sale price. I am returning the item.
customer_reviews.author: ChristinaG

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: suction, suction, suction. Also I appreciate the extendable crevice tool and the flip-up brush. If they had just included these as separate tools, I know they would have gotten misplaced. Yes, it is a noisy little machine, but it is only running a few minutes at a time, so who cares? I have sensitive hearing, so if it didn't affect me, it must not be so bad. I didn't rate battery life or ease of cleaning, because I haven't used it long enough to tell.
customer_reviews.author: pattyb

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, when it worked
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an "old" (only a few years old) dust buster with this one, and the difference is night and day. I didn't even realize what I was missing! The suction power is fantastic. And the battery life is great too. I haven't used the included wall mount yet, but that's also a nice add-on feature that I will probably use. I have a Corgi that sheds like crazy, so having a reliable dust buster is essential. Very happy with this one. Update: 3 months later and it now won’t hold a charge. It turns off after 5 seconds. Disappointing
customer_reviews.author: David R Holtkamp

customer_reviews.title: B+D Quality, Holds its Charge
customer_reviews.text: We've had our Dustbuster for 18 months. It was our second model, and the more modern design is a marked improvement over the original. It has been a very handy & reliable household tool, not too heavy & well balanced. The battery holds a charge a long time, and it has appropriate suction power for a handheld vacuum. Filters are easy to clear of major blockage, but they are a bit cumbersome to reinstall. We seldom use the flip-up brush feature, because the bristles are very short & don't really add value to our common usage in simple vacuuming cleanups.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great suction power, battery takes too long to charge and doesn't last that long
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum has great suction power. The attachments are great in helping get into nooks and crannies, and brushing up any dust or other things that need to get sucked up. I do wish it had a battery indicator light, didn't take too long to charge, and lasted more than a couple hours total. I don't use it for two hours straight, but in the increments I use it, I wish it lasted more.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great battery and great power
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after using the piece of crap dirt devil hand vac. My biggest problem with hand vacs is not so much the suction but the battery. The suction on this is great but the battery life is much longer than any other hand vac I have used. Charged this the other day, used it for probably a good 20 seconds and it still is going strong. I get multiple uses out of this one before having to charge. Granted I only use it for up to 15 seconds at a time. However, it still does a great job and picks everything up quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie J Gale

customer_reviews.title: Good functionality - battery dies insanely quickly.
customer_reviews.text: I've enjoyed using this vacuum, it seems to have great suction and everything about it is exactly what I was looking for. However, it seems to die really quickly after a charge. I'm not sure if this is to be expected, but you might get 5 minutes of use before the thing craps out. I've found that to be a bit of a hassle. I'm giving this three stars because I don't see this as a bad product, and maybe my expectations for battery were too high. Just something you'll want to take note of when buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Jarren Crist

customer_reviews.title: Broken piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: This doesn’t work. Like at all. It sucks for about 3 seconds and turns off. I can wait about 10 seconds and then vacuum for 3 more seconds. Wait for 10. It turns off. Repeat process. I didn’t use this right away and then went on vacation- am now 6 weeks into my purchase so I guess I missed the return window. Awesome. I love spending $40 on a janky broken piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Jeni

customer_reviews.title: B & D hand vacs usually die within a year or two
customer_reviews.text: Currently have two. One which doesn't hold much of a charge any more was about 4 years, but hasn't fully worked the last year or two. The newer one was fine until it wasn't. Perhaps a year or two. Charges up fine. It just turns itself off after about 10 seconds. I am looking for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Cooperberg

customer_reviews.title: Small vacuuming lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: For someone who kinda hates cleaning, this thing has been a lifesaver. It's compact size makes it easy to maneuver into small spaces and this has made vacuuming things like between the couch cushions pretty much effortless. I will say it doesnt have a huge capacity, but that's no problem for quick, everyday cleanups.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca B

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: not bad for picking up random object though I dont believe it performs as the reviews state. Its ok. Would I buy again if I needed a hand held vacuum? yes. Am I raving it about it... not really. Overall nice machine for the price does what you expect it to for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Donka

customer_reviews.title: Eh. Would’ve returned if I could. Had high hopes but disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This thing unfortunately sucks. I had high hopes and didn’t use it in time to be able to return it but honestly, just get a plug-in one so it has more power and for longer or get a more expensive one that will actually work well. This one works ok for about 5 minutes and the charge starts to die.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Good for car and quick jobs
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my car, couch, and most importantly to vacuum silverfish. Suction isn't mind-blowing but it takes car of debris in my car- dirt, crumbs, leaf bits, and anything I just don't feel like compelled to catch in a cup and release. Would be nice if it had a light to indicate charge, but being that I don't use it for extended periods of time, the charge has not been an issue for me. I guess if you have a limousine or something, then it could be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Livesay

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER dusbuster Handheld Vacuum, Cordless, Flexi Blue (HHVI315JO42)
product_meta.description: Style Name:Hand VacThe BLACK+DECKER HHVI315JO42 DUSTBUSTER Cordless Lithium Hand Vacuum, Flexi Blue, is ideal for picking up dirt and debris in your everyday life. This hand vac offers increased bowl capacity (31.8oz) which allows you to collect 50 percent more dirt before needing to empty (in comparison to HNV220BCZ01). The Lithium technology provides strong suction and extended run time. It has a washable bowl and filter which allows for thorough cleaning between jobs. The translucent, bagless dirt bowl makes it easy to see dirt and easy to empty. This vac also includes a crevice tool that provides access to hard to reach areas and it also has a brush which allows you to dust and vacuum upholstery. The wide mouth design effortlessly scoops up large debris and the cyclonic action helps to keep the filter clean and suction strong. 1.5 Amp Hours. This vac has a lightweight and portable design which makes for convenient cleaning. A wall mount provides a versatile storage solution. Includes: Hand Vac, Jack Plug Charger, Wall Mount, Push In Crevice Tool, Push In Brush.
feature_bullets: Dustbowl capacity 13 ounces; Lithium technology provides strong suction and extended run time, 1.5 AH
Increased bowl capacity, washable bowl and filter
Crevice tool for hard to reach areas and brush for upholstery
Wide mouth design for large debris and cyclonic action helps keep the filter clean and suction strong
Lightweight and portable design. 10 hrs, Power Rating : 10.8

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars18,134 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Black & Decker DustBuster Cordless Lithium Hand Vacuum
specifications.Import Designation: Made in the USA or Imported
